messages.content: Why Web Programming is important?

Web programming is important because it allows for the creation and maintenance of websites and web applications. As the use of the internet continues to increase, the importance of web programming grows as well. Web programming languages, frameworks, and tools allow developers to create dynamic and interactive web pages that can be accessed by users all over the world. This is important for businesses and organizations who want to establish a strong online presence and connect with their customers, as well as for individuals who want to share their ideas and creations with others online. Additionally, web programming is an important skill to have in the modern job market, as many companies seek professionals who can develop and maintain their websites and online platforms.
Why Web Programming is important?  at least 5 pages

Web programming has become increasingly important in the world of technology, particularly with the growing use of the internet for personal and business purposes. Web programming helps create and maintain websites, allowing businesses and individuals to reach out to a wider audience and harness the power of the online world.

In this essay, we will discuss the importance of web programming and its impact on the modern world. We will cover the following topics:

1. The role of web programming in creating and maintaining websites
2. The importance of web programming in the business world
3. The rise of e-commerce and the need for web programming
4. The role of web programming in driving innovation and technology advancements
5. The increasing demand for web programming skills in the job market

1. The role of web programming in creating and maintaining websites

Web programming is the backbone of website development and maintenance. Web developers use programming languages like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and PHP to create websites that are visually appealing, functional, and user-friendly. These programming languages allow developers to add interactive elements, animations, and responsive designs that enhance user experience.

Web programming also plays a crucial role in maintaining websites. Once a website is built, it requires regular updates and maintenance to keep it running smoothly. Web developers use programming languages to fix bugs, patch security vulnerabilities, and add new features that improve website functionality.

Without web programming, websites would be static and unresponsive, making them less likely to engage users or generate traffic. With the advent of web programming tools and frameworks, developers can now build more complex websites in less time and with greater ease.

2. The importance of web programming in the business world

Web programming is critical for businesses of all sizes. Websites have become a crucial component of business operations, providing customers with a platform to interact with businesses and learn more about their products and services. A well-designed website can attract new customers, build brand awareness, and increase revenue.

Web programming is particularly important for businesses in the digital age, where most people use the internet to research products and services before making a purchase. Without a website that is visually appealing and easy to navigate, businesses risk losing potential customers to competitors.

Moreover, web programming is also important for businesses looking to expand their online presence. Social media and search engine optimization (SEO) are vital tools for businesses to connect with customers and increase brand recognition. Web programming skills are required to develop successful social media strategies and optimize website content for SEO.

3. The rise of e-commerce and the need for web programming

E-commerce has revolutionized the way people shop, offering consumers the convenience of online shopping and businesses the ability to target customers worldwide. Web programming is a key aspect of creating and maintaining e-commerce websites that are secure, user-friendly, and responsive.

Web developers use programming languages to build online shopping carts, payment gateways, and customer management systems, all of which are essential for a successful e-commerce website. Web programming is also critical for ensuring the security of customer data during transactions, which is essential for building customer trust.

As e-commerce continues to grow, web programming skills will become even more important for businesses looking to capitalize on this trend. Developing a successful e-commerce website requires a team of skilled web developers who can create a user-friendly and secure website that is optimized for high conversion rates.

4. The role of web programming in driving innovation and technology advancements

Web programming has driven innovation and technology advancements in areas such as artificial intelligence (AI), machine learning, and virtual and augmented reality (VR/AR). Web developers are using programming languages to develop advanced algorithms and machine learning models, creating smarter and more efficient systems.

Web programming is also playing a role in the development of VR/AR technology. Developers are creating web-based VR/AR applications that allow users to experience virtual worlds and interact with digital objects. Web programming has provided the necessary tools and framework for developers to build these advanced systems and make them accessible to a wider audience.

Furthermore, web programming has enabled the development of new marketing strategies leveraging online data analysis. Digital marketing techniques, such as data-driven and personalized marketing, are heavily dependent on web programming skills that allow data analysis and tracking of customer behavior. Web programming supports the creation of tools that enable businesses to track customer behavior and tailor their marketing strategies accordingly.

5. The increasing demand for web programming skills in the job market

As businesses continue to rely on websites and the online world to connect with customers, web programming skills have become in high demand. Web development has become a growing field in the technology industry, and the demand for skilled developers continues to rise.

Web programming skills are essential for many jobs in the technology industry, such as front-end and back-end developers, UX/UI designers, data analysts, and digital marketers. Employers are looking for candidates who have a strong understanding of programming languages and frameworks, as well as an ability to adapt to new technologies and programming strategies.

With the increasing demand for web programming skills, there are plenty of opportunities for individuals looking to enter the tech industry. Web programming boot camps, online courses, and certifications offer a variety of options for those looking to learn new programming skills and advance their careers.

In conclusion, web programming has become essential in the modern world of technology and business. It has enabled the creation and maintenance of websites and e-commerce platforms, driven innovation and technological advancements, and provided job opportunities for skilled developers. Web programming skills will continue to be in high demand, making it an ideal field for those interested in advancing their careers in the tech industry.
What are XML and JSON? Discuss their similarities and differences.?

XML (eXtensible Markup Language) and JSON (JavaScript Object Notation) are both markup languages used to transmit data between different platforms, devices, and applications. While both are commonly used, they have some differences.

Similarities:

1. Both XML and JSON are used for data interchange and transmission.

2. Both formats can be used to represent structured data, such as objects, arrays, and key-value pairs.

3. Both XML and JSON allow for data to be human-readable.

4. Both XML and JSON can be used in a wide range of programming languages.

5. Both formats use tags or keys to identify and differentiate data types.

Differences:

1. Syntax: XML uses tag-based syntax, while JSON uses JavaScript syntax. This means that XML consists of elements enclosed in tags, whereas JSON uses key-value pairs separated by commas.

2. File size: JSON tends to have smaller file sizes compared to XML, making it faster to send and receive data and using less bandwidth. 

3. Data types: XML supports a wider range of data types including strings, numbers, dates, and more, whereas JSON is more limited, only supporting a few data types including numbers, strings, and Boolean values.

4. Parsing: Parsing XML involves a lot of boilerplate code and complex structure, while JSON can be easily parsed with just a few lines of code.

5. Parsing complexity: XML can be complex to parse because it can contain several layers of nested data, and the format is more rigid, while JSON has a simpler structure, with only two types of structures: arrays and objects.

In summary, XML and JSON both serve the same purpose of transmitting data; the difference is in their syntax, file size, data types, parsing complexity, and parsing. Which format is best to use is largely dependent on individual use cases and preferences. For instance, if a system needs to exchange complex data and also support multiple data types, then, XML might be the best choice to use. However, if the goal is to minimize file sizes and reduce network overheads while transmitting data, then JSON might be a better fit.
What are XML ?

XML, or eXtensible Markup Language, is a markup language used to encode documents in a format that can be read by both humans and machines. It was developed by the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) in order to provide a standard syntax for creating markup languages that could be useful for a wide range of applications.

XML is often used to create documents that represent structured data, such as user profiles, financial records, and scientific data. The language consists of a set of rules that describe how documents should be structured and encoded, including tags, attributes, and entities.

One of the key features of XML is its extensibility. This means that users can create their own custom tags to represent data specific to their applications, without having to modify the underlying syntax of the language. This makes XML a flexible and powerful tool for exchanging data between different systems and applications.

Another important feature of XML is its ability to define document structures using a Document Type Definition (DTD), XML Schema, or other validation mechanisms. These validation mechanisms help ensure that documents are formatted correctly and adhere to predefined rules and guidelines.

XML files are typically plain text files that can be easily viewed and edited using a text editor or integrated development environment (IDE). They can be parsed and read by a wide range of programming languages and platforms, making XML a popular choice for data transmission and storage in the development world.

In conclusion, XML is a markup language used to encode and structure documents containing structured data. Its extensibility, validation mechanisms, and ease of use make it a powerful tool in data exchange, storage, and transmission.
What are JSON?

JSON, or JavaScript Object Notation, is a lightweight format used to encode data in a format that is easy for both humans and machines to read and understand. It was originally developed for use with JavaScript, but has since become a popular format for data exchange across different programming languages and platforms.

JSON format consists of key-value pairs, with each key being associated with a value, either a string, number, boolean value, or another object or array. This structure is very similar to the way objects are organized in JavaScript.

JSON was developed as an alternative to XML due to its simplicity and ease of use. Compared to XML, JSON has a simpler structure and syntax, making it easier to read and parse. Additionally, JSON typically results in smaller file sizes than XML, which can be a significant factor in reducing network traffic and improving performance.

Like XML, JSON is commonly used for transmitting data between different systems and applications. It is supported by a wide range of programming languages and platforms, making it a highly versatile format for data exchange and storage.

JSON is often used in web applications as a way of transmitting data between the client and server. This allows web developers to create dynamic web applications that can update and refresh data quickly and efficiently without the need for page reloads.

In conclusion, JSON is a lightweight data format used for encoding structured data in a way that is easy for both humans and machines to read and understand. Its simple structure, ease of use, small file size, and wide language and platform support have made it a popular choice for data exchange, storage, and transmission in the programming community.

Добавь интерактивности в игру написанную на python. Добавь очки опыта, с 

помощью которых можно улучшать характеристики персонажа, добавь боссов, 

добавь случайные уклонения и критические удары. Код игры ниже:

import random

# класс игрока
class Player:
    def __init__(self):
        self.health = 100
        self.strength = 10
        self.armor = 5
        self.level = 1

    def level_up(self):  # Функция повышения уровня
        self.level += 1

# класс врага
class Enemy:
    def __init__(self, level):
        enemy_level = random.randint(level, level + 2)
        self.health = enemy_level * 20
        self.strength = enemy_level * 2
        self.armor = enemy_level

# функция боя
def fight(player, enemy):
    round_count = 1
    while player.health > 0 and enemy.health > 0:
        attack_strength = max(player.strength - enemy.armor, 0)
        enemy.health -= attack_strength
        print(f"Round {round_count}: You attack the enemy for 

{attack_strength} damage.")
        if enemy.health <= 0:
            print(f"The enemy is defeated! You win!\n\n")
            player.level_up()  # Повышение уровня
            return True
        print(f"The enemy health: {enemy.health}.")

        attack_strength = max(enemy.strength - player.armor, 0)
        player.health -= attack_strength
        print(f"Round {round_count}: The enemy attacks you for 

{attack_strength} damage.")
        print(f"Your health: {player.health}.")

        if player.health <= 0:
            print("You are defeated! You lose!\n\n")
            return False
        round_count += 1

# функция запуска игры
def game():
    player = Player()
    while True:
        enemy = Enemy(player.level)
        if not fight(player, enemy):
            break

if __name__ == "__main__":
    game()

Чтобы добавить больше интерактивности в вашу игру, мы можем ввести такие функции, как опыт (XP), уровни игрока, улучшение характеристик персонажа, боссов, случайные уклонения и критические удары. Вот как можно это реализовать:

```python
import random

# Класс игрока
class Player:
    def __init__(self):
        self.health = 100
        self.strength = 10
        self.armor = 5
        self.level = 1
        self.xp = 0

    def level_up(self):
        self.level += 1
        self.health += 10
        self.strength += 2
        self.armor += 1
        print(f"\nCongratulations! You reached level {self.level}! Stats increased!")

    def gain_xp(self, amount):
        self.xp += amount
        print(f"You gained {amount} XP!")
        while self.xp >= 100:
            self.xp -= 100
            self.level_up()

    def upgrade_stat(self):
        choice = input("Which stat do you want to upgrade? (1-Health, 2-Strength, 3-Armor): ")
        if choice == "1":
            self.health += 20
            print("Your health has been increased by 20.")
        elif choice == "2":
            self.strength += 5
            print("Your strength has been increased by 5.")
        elif choice == "3":
            self.armor += 3
            print("Your armor has been increased by 3.")
        else:
            print("Invalid choice, no stat was upgraded.")

# Класс врага
class Enemy:
    def __init__(self, level, is_boss=False):
        enemy_level = random.randint(level, level + 2) if not is_boss else level * 2
        self.health = enemy_level * 20
        self.strength = enemy_level * 3 if not is_boss else enemy_level * 4
        self.armor = enemy_level if not is_boss else enemy_level * 2
        self.is_boss = is_boss

# Функция боя
def fight(player, enemy):
    round_count = 1
    while player.health > 0 and enemy.health > 0:
        # Случайные уклонения и критические удары
        critical_hit = random.random() < 0.1
        evade = random.random() < 0.1

        if not evade:
            attack_strength = max(player.strength - enemy.armor, 0)
            if critical_hit:
                attack_strength *= 2
                print("Critical hit!")
            enemy.health -= attack_strength
            print(f"Round {round_count}: You attack the enemy for {attack_strength} damage.")
        else:
            print("The enemy evades your attack!")

        if enemy.health <= 0:
            xp_gained = 50 if not enemy.is_boss else 200
            print(f"The enemy is defeated! You win!")
            player.gain_xp(xp_gained)
            if not enemy.is_boss:
                player.upgrade_stat()
            return True
        print(f"The enemy health: {enemy.health}.")

        # Вражеская атака
        if not (random.random() < 0.1):  # 10% шанс на уклонение игрока
            attack_strength = max(enemy.strength - player.armor, 0)
            player.health -= attack_strength
            print(f"Round {round_count}: The enemy attacks you for {attack_strength} damage.")
        else:
            print("You evade the enemy's attack!")

        if player.health <= 0:
            print("You are defeated! You lose!\n\n")
            return False
        round_count += 1

# Функция запуска игры
def game():
    player = Player()
    level_count = 0
    while player.health > 0:
        level_count += 1
        is_boss = level_count % 3 == 0  # Каждый третий враг - босс
        enemy = Enemy(player.level, is_boss)
        enemy_type = "Boss" if is_boss else "Enemy"
        print(f"\nA {enemy_type} appears! Prepare to fight!")
        if not fight(player, enemy):
            print("Game Over!")
            break

if __name__ == "__main__":
    game()
```

Вот как работают новые возможности:

1. Опыт (XP) и уровни: Игрок получает XP за победу над врагами. После накопления определенного количества XP игрок повышает уровень, а характеристики - увеличиваются.
2. Улучшение характеристик: После победы над обычным врагом игрок может улучшить одну из своих характеристик.
3. Боссы: Каждого третьего врага замещает босс, который сильнее обычных врагов.
4. Случайные уклонения и критические удары: Есть 10% шанс, что игрок или враг уклонятся от атаки, и 10% шанс, что игрок нанесет критический удар.
How do the more powerful B and C engines impact the rocket’s flight?

The more powerful B and C engines increase the thrust and acceleration of the rocket, allowing it to reach higher altitudes and achieve greater speeds. This can impact the rocket's flight by increasing the maximum altitude it can reach, allowing for longer flight durations, increasing the payload capacity, and potentially enabling the rocket to achieve specific mission objectives. However, greater power also requires more precise engineering and control, which can be challenging and increase the risk of failure if not executed properly.
Describe each of the steps in preparing a model rocket for launch.

Here are the steps in preparing a model rocket for launch:

1. Read the instructions carefully: Before assembling the rocket, read the instructions carefully to ensure you understand all the steps and safety precautions.

2. Assemble the rocket: Follow the instructions to assemble the rocket, including attaching the fins, engine mount, and recovery system.

3. Install the engine: Insert the engine into the engine mount and secure it with the included clips or screws. Make sure that the engine is the correct size and type for your rocket.

4. Load the recovery system: If your rocket has a parachute or other recovery system, place it inside the body tube of the rocket and attach it to the ejection charge on the engine.

5. Attach the launch lug: Slide the launch lug onto the rocket and secure it with the included adhesive or clips. The launch lug is used to guide the rocket along the launch rod.

6. Check the recovery system: Ensure that the recovery system is properly loaded and secured inside the body tube. Make sure that the parachute is correctly folded, and the shock cord is attached to both the parachute and the body of the rocket.

7. Conduct a final check: Before launching your model rocket, give it a final check to ensure everything is secure and in place. Confirm that the fins are straight, the engine is attached correctly, and the recovery system is properly loaded.

8. Launch the rocket: Place the rocket on the launch pad with the launch lug positioned onto the launch rod. Connect the launch controller to the launch pad, and follow the instructions to arm the controller and launch the rocket.

After the rocket has been launched, retrieve it carefully and remove the used engine, and inspect the rocket for any damage before launching it again.
Explain each of the steps in safely launching a model rocket.

Here are the steps in safely launching a model rocket:

1. Choose a safe launch site: Select a launch site that is clear of people, buildings, trees, and power lines. Avoid launching near airports, highways, or other areas where the rocket may cause damage or injury if it loses control.

2. Set up the launch pad: Assemble the launch pad according to the instructions, making sure that it is stable and secure. Place it on a flat surface and secure it with stakes or weights to prevent it from moving during launch.

3. Prepare the rocket for launch: Follow the instructions to assemble and load the rocket with the engine and recovery system. Conduct a final check to ensure that everything is secure and in place.

4. Arm the launch controller: Connect the wires from the launch controller to the igniter of the rocket's engine. Arm the launch controller, but do not press the launch button until you are ready to launch.

5. Clear the area: Ensure that everyone is standing at a safe distance from the launch pad. Make sure that there are no people or pets in the vicinity of the rocket.

6. Launch the rocket: Press the launch button on the controller and observe the rocket's flight. Continue to monitor the rocket as it ascends and deploy the recovery system at the appropriate altitude.

7. Retrieve the rocket: Once the rocket has landed, carefully retrieve it, remove the used engine, and inspect it for any damage.

Remember that launching model rockets can be dangerous if not done properly. Always follow the instructions carefully, ensure that everyone involved understands the safety precautions, and take steps to minimize the risk of accidents or injury.

Please advise where you can go to visit when you will be in Nairobi (KENYA)

When visiting Nairobi, Kenya, there are several attractions and places you can explore. Here are some recommendations:

1. Nairobi National Park: This unique wildlife park is located just outside the city center, offering an opportunity to see various animals such as lions, giraffes, zebras, and rhinos, against the backdrop of the city skyline.

2. David Sheldrick Wildlife Trust: Pay a visit to this elephant orphanage to learn about their conservation efforts. You can even get up close and personal with baby elephants during their feeding times.

3. Giraffe Centre: Interact with endangered Rothschild giraffes and feed them by hand at this conservation center. You can also learn about their conservation efforts and enjoy scenic nature trails nearby.

4. Karen Blixen Museum: Step into the world of this famous Danish author at the former home of Karen Blixen, who wrote "Out of Africa". Take a guided tour to learn about her life and the history of the area.

5. Maasai Market: Experience the vibrant atmosphere of this open-air market, where you can find a variety of traditional crafts, jewelry, clothing, and souvenirs. Practice your bargaining skills here!

6. Nairobi Railway Museum: If you're interested in history and trains, this museum showcases an interesting collection of vintage locomotives and carriages. Gain insights into Kenya's railway history.

7. Kazuri Beads: Visit the Kazuri Beads workshop and learn about their fair-trade jewelry craftsmanship. You can witness the intricate process of creating beautiful ceramic beads and even purchase some unique pieces.

8. Nairobi National Museum: Explore Kenya's rich cultural heritage and history through the exhibits in this museum. It houses archaeological, ethnographic, and art collections, providing valuable insights into the country's past.

These are just a few suggestions, and Nairobi has much more to offer. Enjoy your visit to this vibrant and diverse city!

summarize: After Carter took office in 1976, it became clear that his approach to foreign policy differed from Richard Nixon’s realpolitik. Whereas Nixon had prided himself on his realism, Carter emphasized idealism in foreign affairs and insisted that the government not separate foreign policy from “questions of justice, equity, and human rights.” “Fairness, and not force,” Carter urged, “should lie at the heart of our dealings with nations of the world.”

Promoting Justice, Equality, and Human Rights Carter struggled to realize his foreign policy ideals. He was successful in resolving certain issues, like establishing a more equitable relationship with Panama. Panamanians had long regarded a 1903 treaty between the two countries, which gave the United States permanent control over the Panama Canal, as unjust. In 1977, Carter negotiated a treaty to return control of the canal to Panama in 1999. Despite strong objections, the Senate ratified the Panama Canal Treaty in 1978.

The degree of Carter’s success in human rights policy was more varied. At the start of his presidency, Carter was determined to end the United States’ Cold War tendency to support dictators who opposed communism even if they abused human rights. When leftist rebels in Nicaragua ousted the country’s anticommunist dictator in 1979, Carter adhered to his policy of non-intervention. However, he continued to support dictators with poor human rights policies in other parts of the world—including the Philippines and Indonesia—that Carter believed were vital to U.S. interests.

A Step Toward Middle East Peace: The Camp David Accords Carter’s greatest foreign policy achievements were in the Middle East. In 1978, he invited the leaders of Egypt and Israel to commence peace talks at Camp David, a presidential retreat in Maryland. Egypt and Israel had been adversaries in the Yom Kippur War of 1973, during which Israel gained control of land that had previously belonged to its neighbors. Israel’s occupied territories included Egypt’s Sinai Peninsula.

At Camp David, Israeli Prime Minister Menachem Begin and Egyptian President Anwar el-Sadat conversed for 13 tense days. Finally, they reached an agreement called the Camp David Accords, which provided a framework for peace between the two countries. Israel agreed to return the Sinai Peninsula to Egypt, and Egypt agreed to establish diplomatic relations with Israel. Egypt became the first Arab country to formally recognize Israel as a country, which Arab nations had opposed since Israel’s establishment in 1948.

In 1979, Sadat and Begin jointly received the Nobel Peace Prize for their efforts to end hostilities between their countries. Presenting the award, the chairman of the Nobel Committee spoke of Carter’s work, claiming the president was “the master builder responsible for the bridge” that brought “two one-time enemies” together to talk of peace.

President Jimmy Carter shakes hands with Egyptian President Anwar el-Sadat and Israeli Prime Minister Menachem Begin after the Camp David Accords were signed on September 17, 1978. The Accords established diplomatic relations between Israel and Egypt. The agreement also marked a high point in Carter’s Middle Eastern peace efforts. President Jimmy Carter shakes hands with Egyptian President Anwar el-Sadat and Israeli Prime Minister Menachem Begin after the Camp David Accords were signed on September 17, 1978. The Accords established diplomatic relations between Israel and Egypt. The agreement also marked a high point in Carter’s Middle Eastern peace efforts.

The Death of Détente Between the United States and USSR As president, both Nixon and Ford pursued a policy of détente toward the USSR. Carter openly criticized the Soviet Union’s human rights record, but cooperated with Soviet leaders to negotiate a second Strategic Arms Limitation Treaty (SALT II). In a speech before the United Nations, Carter stated, “Peace will not be assured until the weapons of war are finally put away.”

Détente efforts dissolved when Soviet troops marched into Afghanistan in 1979 to assist the country’s failing communist government in subduing a rebellion. Deeming this invasion the “most serious threat to world peace since World War II,” Carter promoted a boycott of the Olympic Games, which was scheduled to be held in Moscow the following summer.

A Hostage Crisis in Iran The Nixon Doctrine fared little better than détente during Carter’s presidency. As part of the Nixon Doctrine’s policy, the United States increased military aid to Iran in the 1970s. In return, the United States expected Iran’s royal ruler, Shah Mohammed Reza Pahlavi, to help maintain stability in the Persian Gulf. Carter continued to support the Shah, despite his poor human rights record, until a revolution swept through Iran in January 1979. Under a religious leader, the Ayatollah Ruholla Khomeini, the revolutionary army declared Iran a republic and forced the Shah into exile. Khomeini then established a new government based on strict adherence to Islamic principles.

Later that year, Carter allowed the exiled Shah to enter the United States for medical treatment, enraging many Iranians. On November 4, 1979, militant students stormed the U.S. embassy in Tehran, Iran’s capital. In violation of international law protecting diplomats, the students took 66 Americans hostage. They paraded the hostages through the streets of Tehran, where an angry crowd shouted, “Death to Carter!”

Carter struggled to bring the hostages home for over a year. Appeals to the United Nations and other U.S. allies for assistance in securing the hostages’ release accomplished little, so Carter ordered a military rescue in April 1980. The mission failed when two helicopters had engine trouble, a third was damaged while landing, and a fourth crashed, killing eight Americans.

The Iran hostage crisis erupted when Iranian students seized Americans working in Tehran’s U.S. embassy. As the crisis persisted, many Americans criticized Carter over his failure to bring the hostages home. They viewed Carter’s inability to free the hostages as indicative of the United States losing power.

summarize: Earth Day’s success prompted the emergence of a grassroots environmental movement. Some groups, such as the Audubon Society and the Sierra Club, had existed for many years. The Sierra Club was founded in 1892, under the leadership of John Muir and other conservationists, to enjoy and protect the mountains of the West. Over time, the club expanded its mission to include preserving wilderness and protecting the environment throughout the nation. In the 1970s, the Sierra Club’s membership expanded from 100,000 to nearly 200,000 people.

In addition, new organizations were created to respond to environmental concerns. Some dealt with local problems, such as cleaning rivers and establishing recycling programs, while others focused on national and global issues. A group called Zero Population Growth (ZPG) formed in 1968 to raise awareness of rapid population growth’s role in accelerating environmental destruction. With the slogan “Stop at Two,” ZPG encouraged families to stay small.

A Decade of Environmental Legislation In response to increasing public concern, Congress enacted a number of environmental laws during the 1970s. Soon after the first Earth Day in 1970, Congress approved legislation to create the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA), which aimed to repair existing environmental damage and to prevent further destruction. The EPA grew quickly—by the end of the decade, it had become the government’s largest regulatory agency, comprising over 10,000 employees.

Air pollution was a major environmental concern during the 1970s. In 1970, Congress amended the Clean Air Act of 1963, setting stricter emissions standards for automobiles, factories, and power plants. In 1977, lawmakers amended the act again, this time to strengthen air-quality standards.

Congress also addressed the issue of water pollution. In 1969, Americans were shocked when the polluted Cuyahoga River burst into flames in Cleveland, Ohio. The Clean Water Act of 1972 limited the amount of sewage and other pollutants flowing into waterways, while the Safe Drinking Water Act of 1974 enabled the EPA to regulate public drinking water quality.

The EPA also worked to eliminate another source of water pollution, called acid rain. Acid rain is precipitation that contains acid as a result of water vapor mixing with molecules of sulfur dioxide and oxides of nitrogen in the atmosphere. These pollutants are released into the atmosphere by automobiles, factories, and power plants that burn fossil fuels. Acid rain can harm plants and animals and is powerful enough to corrode buildings and other stone structures.

During the 1970s, the EPA set limits on car pollution levels. By 1975, manufacturers were equipping cars with catalytic converters, devices that remove pollutants from cars’ exhaust. In 1979, the EPA required that coal-fired power plants use smokestack scrubbers to remove exhaust pollutants. This technology was widely adopted in the 1980s.

Environmental Disasters Fuel Public Concern Two well-publicized environmental disasters in the 1970s underscored public concern about environmental hazards. The first of these incidents occurred in Love Canal, a neighborhood in Niagara, New York. Love Canal residents unknowingly lived atop a chemical waste dump, exposing them to poisons. As a result, residents developed unusually high rates of cancer and birth defects. When officials uncovered the root of the community’s health problems in 1978, Love Canal became a media storm. The federal government eventually relocated 800 Love Canal families to safer areas, while Congress passed laws requiring companies to thoroughly clean their toxic waste sites.

The second disaster of the decade occurred at Pennsylvania’s Three Mile Island Nuclear Generating Station. On March 28, 1979, the nuclear power plant suffered a partial meltdown. Although the situation was eventually controlled, some radioactive gases escaped into the atmosphere. The Three Mile Island accident convinced many Americans that nuclear power plants posed an unacceptable risk to human beings and the natural environment. No new nuclear power plants have been built in the United States since 1979.

Earth Day in 1970 led to the creation of a grassroots environmental movement with the formation of new groups and the expansion of existing ones, such as the Sierra Club. Increased public concern over environmental destruction led Congress to pass numerous environmental laws, including the creation of the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA). The EPA became the largest regulatory agency in the government and addressed issues such as air pollution, water pollution, and acid rain. Two environmental disasters, the Love Canal toxic waste dump and the Three Mile Island nuclear power plant accident, further fueled public concern, culminating in laws requiring companies to clean toxic waste sites and the halt of new nuclear power plant construction in the US.

How do I install gcc and g++

To install `gcc` and `g++` on most Linux distributions, you can use your package manager to download and install the software.

For example, on Ubuntu and Debian-based systems, you can use the following command to install both `gcc` and `g++`:
```
sudo apt-get install build-essential
```

On Fedora and CentOS systems, you can use the following command:
```
sudo yum groupinstall 'Development Tools'
```

On Arch Linux, you can use the following command:
```
sudo pacman -S base-devel
```

After installing `gcc` and `g++`, you can check their versions to verify that they were installed successfully, by running:
```
gcc --version
g++ --version
``` 

You should see a version number for both packages if they are installed correctly.
What's the best terminal and code editor for android

There are many terminal and code editor options available for Android, so it's difficult to recommend one that is "the best" for everyone. However, here's a list of some popular options:

Terminals:

1. Termux - This is a popular terminal emulator app for Android, which provides a full UNIX-like environment on your phone.

2. JuiceSSH - A feature-rich SSH client that allows you to connect to remote servers from your phone.

3. ConnectBot - Another popular SSH client that supports SSH, Telnet, and local shell connections.

Code editors:

1. Visual Studio Code - A popular and powerful code editor developed by Microsoft. It offers support for many programming languages, extensions, and other customization options.

2. Sublime Text - A lightweight and efficient text editor with a clean and minimalistic interface. It also supports many programming languages and plugins.

3. Vim - A highly configurable and versatile text editor with a steep learning curve but powerful features.

4. Emacs - Another popular text editor with many advanced features and customization options, similar to Vim. It has a steeper learning curve than some other editors, but can be very powerful once mastered.

Ultimately, the best terminal or code editor for you might depend on your personal preferences, the type of work you're doing, and the features you require. We recommend trying out a few different options and see which ones work best for your needs.
Would connect bot fave the same issues as termux

Since ConnectBot is also a terminal emulator app on Android, it may face similar issues as Termux regarding package installations for some libraries or dependencies.

However, ConnectBot is specifically designed and focused on SSH connections and accessing remote servers, whereas Termux is more general-purpose and allows you to create a full UNIX-like environment on your phone. So, while they are similar in some ways, they serve different purposes and have different scopes of functionalities.

If you're looking for a terminal emulator on Android that can create a full UNIX-like environment and support various packages and dependencies, Termux might be a better choice. On the other hand, if you're looking for an app to quickly connect to remote servers via SSH, and do basic terminal tasks, ConnectBot might serve you well.

If I treat the seawater with sodium hypochlorite, hydrogen peroxide, or iodine, will the seawater be suitable for microalgae cultivation?

Treating seawater with sodium hypochlorite, hydrogen peroxide, or iodine may help disinfect the water and reduce contaminants, but it is not sufficient to make the seawater suitable for microalgae cultivation on its own. The disinfectants should be used judiciously, as high concentrations of these chemicals can be toxic to the microalgae themselves. 

After disinfection, other factors like nutrient concentrations, pH levels, and light intensity also play important roles in successful microalgae cultivation. You must ensure that the treated seawater provides a suitable environment for microalgae growth, including proper nutrients such as nitrogen, phosphorous, and trace elements important for the specific microalgae species that you are cultivating. Additionally, you should monitor and maintain appropriate conditions, such as temperature, salinity, and pH levels, to ensure successful growth.

I want you to act as an expert of seawater and microalgae. I want to know about seawater pretreatment methods. I am planning to cultivate microalgae using seawater. For every batch, it will be 30 liter of seawater. With this amount of seawater, autoclaving will be difficult. I am thinking about disinfection of seawater through two potential ways:

1. Using heat. For using heat, I am planning to maintain the seawater at 80 to 85 degree celcius for 60 minutes. Will this procedure successfully disinfect the seawater so that I can use it for microalgae cultivation. 

or

2. Using disinfectant, such as sodium hypochlorite, hydrogen peroxide, or iodine. Will any of this disinfectant have potential harmful impact on microalgae?

3. Can I use combined method? Such as, use mild disinfectant and then heat or heat first and then use mild disinfectant?

As an expert in seawater and microalgae, I can suggest the following methods and precautions for seawater pretreatment:

1. Using heat: Heating the seawater to 80-85°C for 60 minutes can help to disinfect it, but you should be cautious about maintaining the temperature and duration accurately as overheating or under heating may not be as effective. When using this method, it's important to consider the effects of evaporation, as significant water loss can occur at high temperatures, potentially affecting the salinity and nutrient levels. After the heating process, you should cool down the water to an optimal temperature for microalgae cultivation (usually around 20-30°C depending on the species).

2. Using disinfectants: Sodium hypochlorite, hydrogen peroxide, and iodine can be effective disinfectants for seawater. However, high concentrations of these chemicals can be toxic to microalgae. After treating the seawater with these disinfectants, you should allow a sufficient amount of time for these chemicals to dissipate or break down before introducing microalgae. For example, sodium hypochlorite breaks down to chloride ions and water, while hydrogen peroxide breaks down into water and oxygen over time. You may need to test the treated water to ensure the disinfectant concentration has reached a non-toxic level for your microalgae species.

3. Combined method: Using a combined method of mild disinfectant and heat could improve disinfection efficiency and minimize the risk of harming microalgae. You can start by adding a small concentration of the chosen disinfectant to the water, allowing time for it to work, and then heating the water to the required temperature for a specific duration. This approach could provide better overall disinfection results, but you need to be cautious of potential synergistic effects that may affect the water quality or microalgae growth. Proper monitoring of disinfectant levels and ensuring complete dissipation or breakdown of the disinfectants is crucial in this approach.

Ultimately, the choice of pretreatment method depends on your specific microalgae species, available resources, and the quality of the seawater used. Proper water quality monitoring and maintenance of appropriate conditions are key factors for successful microalgae cultivation.

Methods of percussion

Percussion instruments can be played in a variety of ways, including:

1. Striking: This is the most common method of playing percussion instruments, where the player strikes or hits the instrument with their hands, mallets, drumsticks, or other implements.

2. Shaking: Some percussion instruments, such as maracas or tambourines, are played by shaking them to create a rhythmic sound.

3. Scraping: Instruments like the guiro or cabasa are played by scraping a stick or mallet along their surface to produce a scraping sound.

4. Rubbing: Some percussion instruments, like the vibraslap or flexatone, are played by rubbing a stick or mallet against a resonating surface to create a unique sound.

5. Stomping: Some percussion instruments, such as the cajon or stomping tube, are played by stomping or tapping on them with the feet to create a percussive sound.

These are just a few examples of the many ways percussion instruments can be played. Each instrument has its own unique playing techniques and methods that can be explored and experimented with to create a wide range of sounds and rhythms.

그를 위해 FC차붐이 들고 나온 전술은 4-4-2포메이션으로, 전통적인 영국식 빅 앤 스몰(Big and small) 식 스트라이커 배치를 필두로 피치 전체에 압박을 가하는 전술이었다.

그리고 그에 대항하여 폴란드 대표 팀은 4-2-3-1포메이션을 꺼내들었다.

“카밀! 중원! 중원에서 가두라고!”

고래고래 소리 지르는 폴란드 선수들.

그들은 더블 볼란치(두 명의 수비형 미드필더)를 두어 중원에서의 수적 우위를 가져갔다.

동시에 다섯 명의 미드필더가 계속해서 공을 돌리며 서서히 라인을 올렸고, 경기장을 넓게 쓰며 측면을 공략하기 시작했다.

압도적인 피지컬을 통해 점유율을 가져가 측면으로 양질의 패스를 뿌린다는 전술이었다.

그리고 전반 6분.

“야로스! 지금!”

탓.

역삼각형을 그리며 굴러다니던 공이 전방으로 빠르게 쇄도했다.

당황한 FC차붐의 수비대형은 지진이라도 일어난 듯 흔들리고 말았다.

그야말로 아수라장.

그와 중에 무너진 수비라인 틈으로 쇄도하는 폴란드의 한 선수가 있었다.

야로스와프 카친스키(Jarosław Kaczy?ski).

발이 빠른 공격수답게 뒷공간으로 잽싸게 파고들었다.

‘뚫었다!’

퍼스트터치만 안정적으로 한다면 무리 없이 일대일 찬스가 연출되는 상황!

카친스키가 발을 뻗었다.

탁.

‘잡았······ 어?’

카친스키의 생각은 완전히 빗나갔다.

어느새 나타난 FC차붐의 한 선수가 카친스키보다 빠르게 달려가 공을 낚아챈 것이었다.

등번호 7번을 달고 있는 꼬맹이, 우호영이었다.

‘뭐야. 얘가 왜 여기 있어···? 얘 공격수 아냐?’

그러거나 말거나, 호영은 거친 숨을 내뱉으며 좌측으로 공을 짧게 패스했다.

그리고.

“뛰어!”

연습 때 몇 번이나 연습했던 역습상황.

측면으로 볼을 배급한 호영은 거침없이 전방으로 달려나갔다.

전방에 서있던 폴란드의 수미(수비형 미드필더)가 1차적으로 붙어봤지만 무의미했다.

훽!

호영은 겉옷 벗듯 상대 수미를 훌러덩 벗겨버리고는 그대로 질주했다.

마치 토끼와 거북이의 대결처럼, 뒤따라오던 상대 미드필더들이 전의를 상실할 정도였다.

‘아직 공도 안 잡았는데?!’

이제 겨우 A급짜리 주력인데, 과연 U급짜리 돌파를 당해낼 수 있을까?

바로 그 순간이었다.

탓.

“나이스 패스!”

측면에서 찔러준 침투패스를 받은 호영이 미친 듯이 달려 나가 안정적인 퍼스트터치로 발에 공을 붙였다.

그리고.

“달려어어어어!”

괴물이 깨어났다.

차미네이터의 치고 달리기로 앞을 가로막고 있던 폴란드의 수비진을 순식간에 무너트렸다.

그들은 대응할 틈도 없이 호영의 페널티박스 진입을 허락하고 말았다.

호영은 거기서 멈추지 않았다.

나는 달린다!

그 의지하나로 수비수들을 모두 추월한 뒤 골키퍼 앞으로 달려갔다.

그리고 슛을 때리려는 순간.

타앗.

“으악!”

폭발적인 우측드리블로 골키퍼마저 따돌린 다음 그대로 골문 안으로 들어갔다.

삐익!

전반 7분.

호영의 발끝에서 선제골이 터져 나왔다.

슛을 때린 것이 아니라, 단순 피지컬만으로 골을 ‘욱여넣은’ 꼴이었다.

가히 압도적이란 말밖에는 어울리지 않는 원더골에 폴란드는 기선을 제압당했다.

“나이스 우호영!”

“크크. 쟤네 지금 당황한 거봐!”

팀원들이 호영의 뒤통수를 한 대씩 치며 득점을 축하해주었다.

하지만 기선제압이고 나발이고, 사실 그건 호영이 의도했던 것과는 거리가 멀었다.

‘아씨···. 멋있게 때리려고 했는데 이거 뭐 다리가 너무 빨라서 주체를 못 하겠네.’

망할.

너무 빨라서 다리가 멈추질 않는다.

아직 미성숙한 하드웨어가 성능 좋은 소프트웨어를 제어하지 못하는 아이러니한 상황이었다.

왜, 사람들이 우스갯소리로 하는 말이 있었다.

차두림의 치고 달리기는 공보다 다리가 빠른 게 단점이라고.

‘진심 이건 오버밸런스야. 괜히 한국의 마이콘이라 불리는 게 아니라고···.’

어쨌든 이로써 1대0.

호영의 선제골로 FC차붐이 리드를 가져갔다.

[거의 60미터를 독주해서 넣은 원더골!! 대단합니다!]

[좋아요. 아주 좋아요, 우호영 선수. 저런 잠재력이라면 육상을 해도 될 것 같은데 말이죠. 정말 대단하네요. 사실 풀 코트 경기장에서 하는 시합이라 많은 기대는 안했거든요. 그런데 저건··· 어우······. 앞날이 매우 기대되는 선수네요.]

해설진은 그나마 양반이지, 폴란드의 코치진은 그보다 더했다.

“저거 대체 뭐야? 9살 맞아?”

“··· 확실합니다.”

호영의 활약에 어이를 상실해버린 폴란드의 코치진이었다.

하지만 세계적으로 저런 아이가 아예 없는 것은 아니었다.

예전에는 아르헨티나의 마라도나가 그랬고, 몇 년 전에는 브라질의 호나우두가 비슷한 케이스였다.

그런데 저건 느낌이 살짝 달랐다.

‘저건 축구를 잘한다기보다는······.’

뭐랄까.

UFC링에 바주카포를 들고 와서 쏴대는 느낌?

그런 말도 안 되는 생각이 들 무렵, 호영이 벌써 두 번째 기회를 잡았다.

“여기!”

탓.

더블 볼란치의 압박에 여의치 않았던 중미 박완규가 호영에게 공을 어거지로 밀어주었다.

볼스피드가 거의 죽은 바람에 호영은 살짝 내려가서 공을 받아야했고, 어느새 따라붙은 상대 수미와 몸싸움을 벌이게 되었다.

호영은 수미를 등진 채 좌우를 살폈다.

상대 공격형 미드필더가 협동수비를 하러 이쪽으로 내려오고 있었다.

‘공간이 없네.’

더욱이 돌파할 여유는 없었다.

빠른 결정이 필요한 시점, 호영은 망설이지 않고 외쳤다.

“달려!”

순간 최전방에 서있던 석형준이 몸싸움을 벌이며 자리경쟁을 시도했다.

지금까지 맞춰온 호흡이라면 충분히 공중 볼 경합에서 승리하고도 남았다.

게다가 170이 넘는 장신이 아닌가!

공중 볼에서 밀릴 염려는 없었다.

호영이 공을 측면으로 흘려 연계플레이를 펼치거나, 페널티박스 안쪽으로 살짝 뛰어주면 완벽한 상황이었다.

“여기!”

마침 박스 안쪽에서 손을 들고 있는 석형준을 향해, 호영이 시선을 옮겼다.

[우호영 선수, 좋아요. 석형준 선수를 바라보고 있거든요? 침착하게, 볼을 내주고 연계플레이를 해야 합니다.]

[아~ 말씀하신 순간! 옆으로 돌았어요!]

호영이 왼쪽으로 몸을 튼 순간, 박스 안쪽의 석형준이 빈 공간으로 파고들며 외쳤다.

“여기! 여기!”

로빙 패스를 달라는 신호였다. 지금껏 연습해왔던 것처럼 말이다.

하지만 호영의 선택은 달랐다.

뻐엉!

빠른 드리블로 슛각을 열어젖히자마자 슈팅을 때렸다.

골키퍼 정면을 향해.

[기습적인 중거리 슈우우우웃!]

탓.

“크앗!”

호영의 기습적인 중거리 슛이 골키퍼의 손끝을 맞고 굴절되었다.

그러나.

[고호오오올!]

키퍼의 손끝을 맞고 굴절된 공은 그대로 골대 안으로 들어가 버렸다.

모두의 예상을 뒤엎은 지능적인 플레이였다.

[아~ 엄청납니다! 거기서 그걸 때려버리네요!]

[심리전에 아주 능통하다고 볼 수 있죠. 공간을 다 내어주고 템포를 늦췄다가, 기습적으로 슈팅 각도를 열어젖히는 게 아주 일품이었습니다. 매우 영리한 플레이라고 볼 수 있어요. 석형준 선수의 움직임도 아주 좋았구요.]

는 개뿔.

‘이게 되네?’

방금 전 골은 사실 엉겁결에 만들어진 것이었다.

설마 이게 될까?

싶어 해봤더니 됐을 뿐이다.

‘와···. 메날두는 항상 이런 느낌이려나.’

신기했다.

머릿속으로 상상한 플레이를 실제로 실현할 수 있다니.

빠른 다리와 꽤나 묵직한 중거리 슈팅의 합작이었던 것이다!

“와우.”

생각하는 대로 몸이 따라주니 축구가 이렇게 재미있을 수가 없다.

과연 이게 성인팀에서도 먹힐지는 모르겠지만 아무렴 지금 당장은 좋았다.

“흐흐.”

자칫하면 상대팀을 비웃는 것처럼 보일 수도 있지만 터져 나오는 웃음을 멈출 수 없었다.

왜냐하면.

[꽤나 묵직한 중거리 슛(C+)↑]

재능이 성장했기 때문이다.

Translate to english

Chapter 14: The Carminator on Top of a Lamborghini (2)

[The match has begun. On the left, the Polish U-13 team, and on the right, FC Cha Boom. How do you see this match, commentator Seo Young-wook?]

[Yes. Initially, considering the physical conditions of the European players, it seems they will have an advantage in air control. Uh, actually, the Polish U-13 team won last year's European Youth Championship, mainly because of a player named Lewandowski. This time, that player is missing, so I think it's a match that can certainly be won.]

[I see. Then, what about Woo Ho-young, wearing number 7 for FC Cha Boom? As many of our national audience may already know, he has been performing remarkably well on 'Run, Shoot-Dol-i'.]

[Yes. Woo Ho-young's presence will definitely be the variable. Well, we'll have to see.]

Each half lasts 25 minutes.

Although difficult to expect high viewership since it was broadcasted on cable channel MBS-Espn rather than on MBS, there was significant interest as it was the first international youth tournament held domestically.

However, earlier in the day, the B group match between Germany and the Korean U-13 team ended with a 1-7 loss for Korea, stirring public outrage.

In other words, FC Cha Boom's victory was the only hope for today.

For this, FC Cha Boom resorted to a 4-4-2 formation, leading with a traditional British-style big and small striker deployment and employing tactics that pressured the entire pitch.

On the other hand, the Polish team brought out the 4-2-3-1 formation.

"Kamil! Midfield! Press the midfield!"

The Polish players shouted vociferously, using their double pivot (two defensive midfielders) to gain a numerical advantage in the midfield.

At the same time, their five midfielders continually circulated the ball, slowly pushing up the line and starting to dominate the flanks.

With an overwhelming physical presence, they took possession and aimed for quality passes to the flanks.

Six minutes into the first half.

"Jaros! Now!"

Tap.

The ball rolling in an inverted triangle quickly charged forward.

FC Cha Boom's defense staggered, as though an earthquake had struck.

It was utter chaos.

Amidst this, a Polish player darted through a gap in the crumbling defense line.

It was Jarosław Kaczyński.

Living up to the reputation of a fast striker, he swiftly broke into space.

‘We broke through!’

With a stable first touch, it would have been an easy one-on-one chance!

Kaczyński extended his foot.

Thud.

'Caught it······ huh?'

Kaczyński's expectations were completely off the mark.

An FC Cha Boom player, who appeared out of nowhere, reached the ball faster and snagged it away.

It was Woo Ho-young, the little one with number 7.

‘What? Why is he here···? Isn't he a forward?’

Regardless, Ho-young—breathing heavily—shifted the ball swiftly to the left.

And then...

"Run!"

A counter-attack that had been practiced numerous times.

After distributing the ball to the flank, Ho-young dashed forward without hesitation.

The Polish pivot who initially tried to close him down was of no consequence.

Whoosh!

Ho-young easily shook off the chasing pivot and charged on.

It was like a tortoise and hare showdown, to the extent that the pursuing midfielders seemed to lose their spirit.

‘They haven't even gotten the ball yet?!’

Currently racing at A-grade speed, could they handle his U-grade breakthrough?

Right at that moment.

Tap.

"Nice pass!"

Ho-young, receiving a penetrating pass from the side, ran madly and managed a stable first touch on the ball with his feet.

And then...

"Charge!"

The Carminator had awakened.

Ho-young's dash shattered the Polish defense line in seconds.

Unable to respond in time, they reluctantly allowed Ho-young entry to the penalty box.

Ho-young didn't stop there.

I keep running!

With that one determination, he overtook all defenders and approached the goalkeeper.

Just as he was about to shoot.

Tap.

"Ugh!"

With a powerful right dribble, he outmaneuvered the goalkeeper and entered the goal.

Whistle!

In the seventh minute of the first half, Ho-young's foot unleashed the opening goal.

It was not about shooting the goal, but rather 'forcing' the goal into the net with sheer physical prowess.

'Absolutely overwhelming' was the only phrase suitable for such a wonder goal, leaving Poland pressed at the start.

"Nice Ho-young!"

"Keke. Look at how panicked they are now!"

The teammates congratulated Ho-young's score by patting the back of his head.

However, the initial press and everything else didn't really matter much to Ho-young, as it wasn't what he had intended.

'Ah, damn it... I wanted to shoot it coolly, but my legs were too fast to control.'

Cursed, my legs wouldn't stop because they were too fast.

The still immature hardware couldn't control the high-performance software, an ironic situation.

After all, there's a saying that goes around jokingly.

That Cha Du-rim's dribble is too fast, even faster than the ball, which is a drawback.

'For real, this is overbalance. It's no joke they call him Korea's Maicon...'

Anyhow, it was 1-0.

With Ho-young's opening goal, FC Cha Boom took the lead.

[He just sprinted 60 meters for that wonder goal! Incredible!]

[That's good, very good, player Woo Ho-young. With that potential, he could even do athletics. Truly amazing. I didn't expect much since it was a full-court match, but that was... oh... the future of this player is very promising.]

The commentators were rather mild; the Polish coaches were even more agitated.

"Is that kid really 9 years old?"

"...Yes, he is."

Poland's coaching staff lost their composure over Ho-young's performance.

However, it was not as if such kids didn't exist in the world.

In the past, there was Argentina's Maradona, and a few years ago, Brazil's Ronaldo was a similar case.

But this felt a bit different.

It was like bringing a bazooka to a UFC ring and shooting it off.

While the Polish coaches were trying to grasp the situation, Ho-young had already seized a second opportunity.

"Here!"

Struggling with the pressure from the double pivot, central midfielder Park Wan-gyu forced the ball to Ho-young.

Since the ball's speed had almost died, Ho-young had to move back a bit to receive it, and he soon engaged in a physical fight with the opposing pivot.

Ho-young glanced left and right with the pivot on his back.

The opposition's attacking midfielder was coming down to join the defensive effort.

'There's no space.'

It was a moment that demanded a quick decision. Without hesitation, Ho-young shouted.

"Run!"

At that instant, Seok Hyung-jun, positioned at the very front, contested for position through a physical struggle.

If the synergy that had been honed to this point was utilized well, they'd win the aerial duel with plenty to spare.

Especially with Seok’s towering height over 170 centimeters!

There was no worry about being outmatched in the air.

Ho-young could either play a lateral pass and build a play, or lob the ball into the penalty box for a perfect opportunity.

"Here!"

Seok Hyung-jun, inside the box with his hand raised, signalled for a lobbed pass, a signal they had rehearsed countless times.

But Ho-young's choice was different.

Zoom!

After opening up a shooting angle with a swift dribble, he fired a shot.

Straight at the goalie.

[An unexpected mid-range shot!]

Thud.

"Ugh!"

Ho-young's sudden mid-range shot grazed the goalkeeper's fingertips and deflected.

However...

[Goal!]

The deflected ball slipped into the goalpost and went in.

It was an intelligent play that defied everyone's predictions.

[Oh, it's tremendous! He took that shot from there!]

[A smart play, and it shows he's adept at psychological battles. The way he opened up space and slowed down the tempo, and then suddenly opened up the shooting angle was first-rate. It was an intelligent play. And Seok Hyung-jun’s movement was also very good.]

If only.

‘This actually worked?’

The recently scored goal was, in fact, a fluke.

Trying it on a whim and succeeding was unexpected.

'Wow... Is this how Ronaldo and Messi always feel?'

It felt miraculous.

He could actually bring to life the plays he envisioned in his mind.

A combination of fast legs and a quite powerful mid-range shot!

"Wow."

Football was never this fun when the body acted out what the mind imagined.

It remained to be seen if this would work in an adult team, but it sure was enjoyable at that moment.

"Chuckle."

It might seem like he was mocking the opposing team, but he couldn't stop the burst of laughter.

Because...

[Quite a hefty mid-range shot (C+)↑]

His talent had grown.

015. 한국인이라면(1)


‘혹시 두림이 형 재능도 키울 수 있는 건가?’

그렇다는 것은 즉, 노력만 한다면 오리지널을 뛰어넘을 수 있다는 뜻이었다.

‘그럼 대박인데?’

기분이 급격히 좋아진 호영은 호우 세리머니를 한 뒤 공을 들고 하프라인으로 돌아갔다.

숨이 턱 끝까지 차올랐지만 잠시도 쉬고 싶지 않았다.

축구장에서 뛰어다닐 수 있다는 것 자체만으로 행복했기 때문에.

그야말로 물 만난 고기가 따로 없었다.

하지만 무리하지는 않았다.

무릎은 생명이니까, 더도 말고 덜도 말고 소박하게만.

‘해트트릭만 하자.’

[아! 우호영의 두 번째 골이 폴란드를 궁지에 몰아넣는군요!]

전반전이 막바지에 다다를 무렵.

체력이 서서히 빠진 폴란드 선수들은 호영이 공을 잡을 때마다 지레 겁을 먹었다.

그 모습이 빤히 드러나 보는 사람으로 하여금 동정심을 느끼게 했다.

허나 호영에게 자비란 없었다.

되레 잘 됐다는 듯 미친 소처럼 필드를 누비고 다녔다.

뻐엉!

발에 걸리는 족족 슛을 때리는 모습은 세컨드 스트라이커보다는 전형적인 골게터에 가까웠다.

그 탓에 호영의 파트너였던 석형준은 있으나마나한 병풍이 돼버렸다.

단 한차례의 유효슈팅도 못 때려본 석형준이 호영에게 달려왔다.

“야 우호영. 너 왜 나한테 패스 안 해?”

“음.”

진즉에 어시스트 15회를 달성한 호영으로서는 솔직히 석형준에게 공을 띄워줄 이유가 없었다.

“형. 일단 이기고 봐야지!”

“그렇긴 하지만······.”

“조금만 기다려보라고! 기회가 있을 거야.”

거대한 덩치와는 다르게 소심한 구석이 다분한 석형준은 고개를 푹 숙인 채 돌아갔다.

그렇게 시간은 흘러 어느덧 후반 12분, 경기종료까지 13분 남은 상황.

호영의 발끝에서 묵직한 중거리 슛이 뻥 하고 터져 나왔다.

이른바 45도 슛이라 불리는, 페널티 에어리어 부근 코너에서 때린 슛이었다.

[우호영 선수! 해트트릭! 해트트릭을 기록합니다!]

[아~ 정말 대단합니다. 앞서 독일의 VFB 슈트트가르트 팀 선수가 2골을 넣긴 했지만 해트트릭을 기록한 선수는 없었거든요? 그런데 우호영 선수가 그걸 달성했군요!]

[맞습니다. 정말이지 미래가 기대되는 선수에요. 저런 유망주는 협회차원에서도 잘 관리를 해줘야하거든요? 개인적인 생각이지만 우호영 선수가 이번 대회의 골든볼에 선정될 수 있지 않을까 조심스레 기대를 해봅니다.]

더욱이 거기서 끝이 아니었다.

후반종료 직전.

수비진을 파이브 백으로 늘린 폴란드 대표 팀에서 호영을 집중마크 하고 있는 가운데, 박완규가 낮게 찔러준 땅볼패스가 뒷공간으로 깊숙이 들어갔다.

그 순간 호영은 빠른 발을 이용해 절묘하게 오프사이드라인을 뚫고 페널티박스 안쪽으로 진입했다.

하지만 패스가 너무 길었던 탓에 상대 골키퍼가 이미 나와 있었다.

‘여의치 않아.’

옆을 봤다.

간절한 표정으로 목 놓아 소리치고 있는 소년이 눈에 들어왔다.

‘받아라. 택배 간다!’

툭.

호영이 그쪽으로 공을 살짝 띄어주었다.

그 자리를 점하고 있던 석형준이 머리를 갖다 댔다.

철렁!

환상적인 호흡이 만들어낸 네 번째 골이었다.

“나이스 패스!!”

첫 득점포를 쏘아올린 석형준은 곧장 관중석으로 뛰어가더니 주먹을 꽉 움켜쥐었다.

한 겨울의 추위에도 열심히 응원 중인 자신의 어머니를 향한 세리머니였다.

그 모습에 괜히 콧잔등이 시큰해진 호영도 얼른 눈알을 굴렸다.

둘째 호일이를 친정에 맡겨두고 온 어머니 김희선이 보였다.

세상에서 제일 행복한 얼굴을 하고 있었다.

호영도 덩달아 기분이 좋아져서는 엄지를 척 내밀고 돌아섰다.

그 앞을 석형준이 막아섰다.

“호영아! 패스 짱이었어! 고마워!”

“고맙기는. 축구는 원래 같이 하는 거야!”

유명한 축구선수가 했던 말 하나가 머릿속에 떠올랐다.

인생은 혼자지만 축구는 함께라는 말······.

“우웩.”

오그라들지만 가슴에 와 닿는 건 부정할 수 없었다.

이게 바로 축구니까.

그리고 오늘 경기를 통해 다시 한 번 느꼈다.

축구, 너무 재밌다고.

삐익!

경기는 4대0으로 끝났고, 3골 1어시스트를 기록한 호영이 MOM으로 선정되었다.

경기가 끝난 후에는 인터뷰가 진행되었다.

“4대0으로 완승을 거두는데 가장 공헌을 많이 했던, 승리의 주역 우호영 선수를 만나보겠습니다! 안녕하세요 우호영 선수.”

“네. 안녕하세요.”

“먼저 최우수 선수 선정 축하드리구요. 오늘 3골 1도움으로 MOM에 선정되었는데 소감 한 마디 해줄래요?”

“네. 일단은 생각보다 쉬운 경기였구요.”

“네?”

“사실 키 차이도 좀 나다보니 어려운 경기를 할 줄 알았는데 팀원들이 잘 받쳐줘서 승리한 것 같습니다.”

“하하. 똑 부러지는 소감이네요. 그럼 혹시 따로 하고 싶은 말이 있다면 해볼래요?”

“크흠. 엄마아빠 사랑해요.”

별 다른 이유는 없었다.

지난 생에 못해본 효도, 이번에는 해보고 싶었으니까.

“아 그리고 한 마디만 더 할래요.”

“하하! 그럼요. 얼마든지 하세요.”

“큼큼. 네. 일단 응원해주신 시청자 여러분들께 감사하다는 말씀 전하겠구요. 그리고 저는 훗날 세계 최고의 축구선수가 될 테니 응원 많이 해주세요!”

탁탁탁!

자신만만한 표정으로 가슴을 세 번 두드리는 호영.

그 모습을 바로 옆에서 지켜보던 리포터가 웃음을 꾹 참았다.

그러자 호영이 한 마디 덧붙였다.

“두고 보세요!”

21세기 최고의 멘트가 될지, 아니면 흑역사가 될지는 아무도 모르는 일이었다.

“으에에에엑! 내가 왜 그랬지?”

그날 밤, 집에서 혼자 녹화방송을 보던 호영은 옆에 있던 이불을 걷어찼다.

자신이 인터뷰하는 영상은 마치 중2병에 찌든 놈이 허세를 부리는 것 같았기 때문이다.

‘아 몰라! 진짜 저 말대로 세계 최고가 되면 되잖아? 그럼 다시없을 레전드 영상이 탄생하는 거고!’

그리고 그날, 호영은 다시금 인터넷에 뜨거운 감자로 등극했다.

[작성자: 파워형]

-얼마 전 부X 건다던 놈입니다. 호영이가 해외팀을 상대로 단 한 골이라도 넣으면 그걸 뗀다고 했는데 사실 제가 삼대독자입니다.

부득이한 사정으로 약속을 지키지 못했으니 그 대신 호영이의 평생 서포터가 될 것을 맹세하겠습니다.

우호영 파이팅!

그 외에도 자극적인 제목의 기사들이 줄줄이 쏟아져 나왔다.

드디어 한국에도 세계적인 스타가 탄생할 거라는 말이 있는가하면, 상파울루 유소년 감독이 우호영의 부모에게 접근했다는 소문이 나돌기도 했다.

많은 관심이 부담스러울 법도 했지만, 관심종자 기질이 살짝 있었던 호영은 현 상황을 즐기고 있었다.

그리고 다음 경기준비에 전념을 기울였다.

바로 다음날도 경기가 있었다.

스웨덴 듀가렌스IF와의 시합이었는데, 양 팀이 초반부터 공격적으로 나와 서로 만만찮은 공세를 퍼부었다.

난타전을 주고받은 결과 3:2라는 스코어가 나왔다.

승자는 FC차붐.

2골 1어시스트를 기록한 호영이 또 한 번 MOM에 선정되었다.

그리고 다음날인 20일.

포르투갈의 명문 FC포르투는 확실히 우승후보답게 상대하기 버거웠지만 호영의 멀티 골이 극적인 무승부를 이뤄냈다.

오히려 그 다음날 8강전에서 맞붙은 파라과이가 상대하기 더 수월했다.

초반에 실점을 먹었지만, 영혼의 투톱 석형준과 우호영이 2골을 잇달아 퍼부어 역전드라마를 연출해냈다.

진짜 중요한 건 그 다음, 22일에 벌어진 4강전이었다.

[많은 팬 분들이 오늘만을 손꼽아 기다려왔을 겁니다. 바로 잠시 후, 일본 13세 이하 대표팀과의 경기가 시작될 예정인데요. 일본이 A조를 2등으로 통과했군요?]

[예. 이변이 일어났죠. A조의 상파울루FC가 멕시코 대표팀을 크게 이기는 바람에, 일본이 어부지리로 토너먼트에 진출을 하게 됐어요. 하지만 만만하게 볼 상대는 결코 아닙니다. 현재 일본에서 한창 주가를 올리고 있는 선수가 있거든요?]

전문가들이 평가하기를 A조는 죽음의 조 그 자체였다.

더글라스와 카세미루가 이끄는 상파울루FC를 제외하더라도, 멕시코 대표 팀에는 신성 카를로스 벨라(Carlos vela)가 있었고, 일본 대표팀에도 마찬가지로 실력이 출중한 플레이어가 한 명 있었다.

‘그 녀석을 여기서 보게 될 줄이야.’

경기 직전, FC차붐의 라커룸.

호영은 흥분이 가시질 않았다.

더구나 오늘 경기에 앞서 이상운 코치가 신신당부했었기 때문이다.

일본 팀의 키 플레이어를 조심하라고.

그래서 FC차붐은 ‘그 녀석’을 막을 전술까지 세부적으로 세운 상태였다.

과연 그게 먹힐지는 가봐야 알겠지만 말이다.

‘어쨌든 일본전만큼은 반드시 이겨야지.’

이상운이 잠시 자리를 비운 사이, 호영이 자리에서 일어나 박수를 쳤다.

“형들!”

막내가 단체를 휘어잡으려면 그만한 힘이 있어야하는 법이지만 호영에게는 그럴만한 능력이 있었다.

바로 실력이라 하는 그것.

자신보다 나이 많은 선수들을 불러 모은 호영이 외쳤다.

“이기자!”

“이기자!!”

어째서일까.

그 여느 때보다 단합이 잘되고 있었다.

일본에 적대심을 가지고 있는 건 아니고, 그저 당연히 이겨야겠다는 생각뿐이었다.

그건 마치, 한국인이라면 태생적으로 가지고 있는 기본 패시브 같은 느낌이었다.

라커룸에 의지가 불타올랐다.

여기서 이기는 팀이 서울상암월드컵 경기장으로 가는 것이다.

선수들은 결의를 다진 채 피치 위로 올랐다.

파주NFC 새싹구장.

드넓게 펼쳐진 푸른 잔디 위로 붉은색과 파란색의 물결이 뒤섞였다.

파란색유니폼의 일본 대표 팀과 붉은색유니폼의 FC차붐.

호영이 슬쩍 눈알을 굴려 구석 한편을 바라보았다.

가장 끝 쪽에 개구쟁이 같은 외모의 소년이 서있었다.

바로 일본의 키 플레이어.

[카가와 신지]

보유재능

-축구영재(B)

-섬세한 볼 터치 감각(C+)

-공간을 활용한 오프 더 볼 무브먼트(C)

(조건을 만족할 시 한 가지 재능을 탐할 수 있습니다.)

(조건1: 경기에서 승리하기)

(조건2: 공 다섯 차례 빼앗기)

볼 커팅 5회.

‘아놔. 나 수비수가 아니라 공격수라고요.’

이렇게 된 이상 답은 하나.

‘프리롤(Free role)로 간다.’

호영이 두 주먹을 불끈 쥐어보였다.

별다른 이유 없이, 평소에 있지도 않던 애국심이 솟구치기 시작했다.

그리고 이런 기회가 생긴다면 꼭 한 번 해보고 싶었던 게 하나 있었다.

호영이 카가와에게 시선을 던졌다.

“신지 상.”

“응?”

“유 다이.”

“······?”

뭐지 이 미친놈은?

카가와가 그런 표정을 짓든 말든, 호영은 자기 혼자 전의를 불태우고 있었다.

'Could it be possible to improve Du-rim hyung's talent as well?'

Feeling suddenly elated, Ho-young performed a celebratory ceremony and then picked up the ball and returned to the halfway line.

Explian different kind of risk. Pure risk, speculative risk, inherent risk, residual sirk

1. Pure Risk: This type of risk involves the possibility of loss or damage, but no potential for gain or profit. Examples of pure risk include natural disasters such as floods, earthquakes, and hurricanes, as well as illness, car accidents, and death. Pure risks are typically insurable and mitigated through risk management strategies such as insurance or avoidance.

2. Speculative Risk: This type of risk involves the potential for both loss or damage and gain or profit. Examples of speculative risk include investing in the stock market, starting a business, or gambling. Speculative risks are typically not insurable and are often managed through diversification and hedging strategies.

3. Inherent Risk: This type of risk is an inherent part of a particular activity or situation. Examples of inherent risk include the risks associated with owning a manufacturing plant, the risks of mining, or the risks associated with driving a car. Inherent risks are often managed through preventative measures such as safety protocols and risk assessments.

4. Residual Risk: This type of risk is the remaining risk that is present after all other risk management strategies have been implemented. Residual risks are typically small, but they can still pose a threat to an organization or individual. Examples of residual risk include the risk of a cyber attack after implementing cybersecurity measures or the risk of a car accident after practicing safe driving habits. Residual risks can be managed through ongoing risk assessments and monitoring.
What are different type of risk

There are many different types of risk, but below are some of the most common:

1. Financial Risk: This type of risk involves the potential for financial loss or damage, such as currency exchange rate fluctuations, credit risk, and interest rate risk.

2. Business Risk: This type of risk involves the potential for loss or damage to a business, such as market risk, competition risk, and operational risk.

3. Reputational Risk: This type of risk involves the potential for damage to a company or individual's reputation, often due to negative publicity or public perception.

4. Legal Risk: This type of risk involves the potential for legal action or liability, such as breach of contract, intellectual property infringement, and regulatory compliance risk.

5. Operational Risk: This type of risk involves the potential for loss or damage due to internal processes or systems, such as technology risk, fraud risk, and supply chain risk.

6. Human Risk: This type of risk involves the potential for loss or damage due to human factors, such as employee misconduct, labor disputes, and talent retention risk.

7. Environmental Risk: This type of risk involves the potential for loss or damage due to environmental factors, such as natural disasters, pollution, and climate change.

Story prompt: Alex and Sharon are close friends who enjoyed discussing random topics. Today, Sharon stated, "The trolley problem is always going to be a problem, because if we are unaware of what happens next, then letting five people live and one person die could result in negative consequences, and vice versa."

Alex and Sharon sat on a cozy park bench, their usual meeting spot for engaging in their thought-provoking conversations. The golden rays of the setting sun painted the sky in vibrant hues, casting a warm glow over the two friends.

Sharon leaned back, her eyes contemplating the distant horizon. This time, her mind had wandered to the infamous moral dilemma known as the trolley problem. It wasn't an uncommon topic for them to delve into. Alex, on the other hand, felt intrigued by the complexity of the situation and leaned forward, eager to participate in the discussion.

"Well, Sharon, isn't the trolley problem more about hypotheticals and philosophical debates rather than real-world situations?" Alex asked, raising an eyebrow.

Sharon replied thoughtfully, turning her gaze towards Alex. "Yes, you're right. It's a moral exercise often employed by philosophers, but it touches upon fundamental ethical choices we all face in varying ways. The crux of the problem lies in the uncertainty of the consequences."

Alex nodded, taking in Sharon's point. "You mean, the weight of our moral decisions often hinges on our ability to predict outcomes?"

Sharon smiled, pleased at the astute observation. "Exactly. The trolley problem asks us to make a choice: either pull a lever diverting the trolley to kill one person and save five, or do nothing and let the trolley continue on its course, resulting in the death of the five. But what if unforeseen consequences emerge from our choice?"

The breeze rustled through the trees, lending an eeriness to their conversation. Alex pondered Sharon's words, recognizing the complexity she was highlighting. "Ah, I see what you mean. If we lack insight into the full scope of the situation, we can't be certain that we made the right choice. There's a potential for negative repercussions even with the best intentions."

Sharon nodded, her eyes catching a glimpse of a couple strolling hand in hand. "Exactly. It appears simple in theory because the trolley problem isolates variables, forcing us to make an immediate, singular decision. But life isn't always so neatly compartmentalized."

As the conversation deepened, Alex began to appreciate the nuanced perspective Sharon was offering. The trolley problem was a microcosm that mirrored life's intricate moral challenges. Their discussion reframed the problem, unlocking new layers of understanding.

"We can't rely solely on logical analysis when grappling with moral dilemmas," Sharon said, her voice turning pensive. "We have to consider the unpredictability of consequences, the unique circumstances of each scenario, and the limits of our knowledge."

A sense of insight washed over Alex. "So, in the end, it's not about finding the perfect solution but acknowledging the complexities and weight of our choices?"

Sharon smiled, her eyes filled with newfound clarity. "Yes, exactly! The trolley problem, although hypothetical, is a reminder that our actions have far-reaching consequences. It's crucial to embrace our individual responsibility when making difficult choices, even in the face of uncertainty."

As the sun dipped beneath the horizon, Alex and Sharon continued their conversation, delving deeper into the multifaceted nature of morality and ethics. Their friendship thrived on these intellectual exchanges, always leaving them inspired and eager to explore new ideas. And although the trolley problem remained a never-ending enigma, they found solace in navigating life's dilemmas together, armed with newfound wisdom and an unwavering dedication to understanding the consequences of their actions.

The next day, Alex brought up an unusual comparison to Sharon, "So, we're all familiar with eldritch entities like Cthulhu or Yog Sothoth, but I feel like something like that exists already." Sharon replied, "What would that be?" Alex responded, "The Sun. Think about it. It is incomprehensibly ancient, older than the Earth, let alone humanity. It gives us life, but is also capable of death, and isn't discriminate about it. We have worshipped the Sun since the dawn of humanity and will continue to be here for the long run. Like, the first life forms on Earth that could see, saw the same Sun in the sky as we are today. Cthulhu and other eldritch entities exist in Lovecraft an cosmic horror fiction, but if there was anything similar to them, it's the Sun."

The following day, Alex and Sharon found themselves once again engrossed in conversation, their minds aflame with curiosity. As the gentle breeze danced around them, Alex brought forth an intriguing comparison that had been swirling in their thoughts.

"So, Sharon, have you ever considered that the Sun could be akin to those eldritch entities we often encounter in Lovecraftian tales? I mean, think about it," Alex proposed, eyes gleaming with excitement.

Sharon's eyebrows furrowed in contemplation, intrigued by the unusual connection. "The Sun? I never thought of it in that way. Please, elaborate."

With a spark of enthusiasm, Alex began to paint a vivid picture. "Just like Cthulhu or Yog Sothoth, the Sun is a force beyond our comprehension. It has existed for billions of years, far older than our Earth and the entirety of humanity. Its ancientness is baffling, and it holds dominion over countless celestial bodies."

Sharon nodded, her interest piqued. "Yes, the Sun's immense age and power are undeniable. It is the very source of life on Earth, sustaining all living beings. Yet, it possesses a destructive force as well. Solar flares, intense radiation, and even the potential for a cataclysmic end in the form of a supernova."

Alex leaned forward, their voice filled with a sense of wonder. "Exactly! The Sun is like a deity to us, revered and worshipped since the earliest civilizations. From ancient cultures to modern religions, its significance has remained steadfast. Our ancestors gazed upon the same Sun that we see today, contemplating its mysteries."

Sharon's eyes widened, captivated by the parallels being drawn. "It's fascinating to view the Sun through this lens. It evokes a sense of cosmic horror, the realization that we are mere mortals, dwarfed by such a colossal and enigmatic entity."

Alex nodded, their excitement palpable. "Indeed, the Sun is indifferent to our existence, much like those eldritch beings. It operates on an incomprehensible scale, beyond our understanding. We are but insignificant specks in the vastness of its cosmic dance."

As the conversation flowed, their minds became entangled in the awe-inspiring notion of the Sun as a mysterious and powerful force, transcending human comprehension. They explored the shared themes of fear, awe, and the simultaneous life-giving and destructive nature that both eldritch entities and the Sun embodied.

"I suppose, in a way, the Sun represents the epitome of our insignificance in the grand scheme of the cosmos," Sharon mused, a sense of humility coloring her words. "It reminds us that while we may strive for understanding, there will always be forces beyond our grasp."

Alex smiled, satisfied with the direction their conversation had taken. "Precisely. The Sun encapsulates the cosmic horror Lovecraft envisioned, not as a malevolent being, but as a reminder of our own limitations. It compels us to embrace our curiosity, to explore the unknown, and to find solace in our collective quest for knowledge."

As the sun dipped below the horizon, casting a warm glow over their faces, Alex and Sharon continued to contemplate the cosmic mysteries that surrounded them. In their shared musings, they found a profound appreciation for the incomprehensible and an enduring thirst for understanding the vast universe that stretched before them. Together, they embraced the unfathomable, ready to unravel its secrets, one conversation at a time.

3. Microsoft OCR - offered in Microsoft's Computer Vision API, it enables organizations to extract printed text from images, analyze handwriting, and extract digital text from images.

4. Amazon Textract - a cloud-based OCR service that can extract text from a variety of image and document types. There is a free tier available with 1,000 pages per month.

5. Google Cloud Vision API - provides OCR services through the Document Text Detection feature which can extract text from scanned documents, and handwritten notes.

6. Kraken OCR - an open-source OCR engine that uses deep learning and can recognize text in various languages. It can process scanned documents, handwritten notes, and printed material.

All of these APIs offer varying levels of accuracy and may require some level of configuration to work with your specific use case. Be sure to review the terms of service for each API to ensure that they meet your requirements and that you are complying with their usage policies.
Is the Microsoft OCR you mentioned above free?

Microsoft offers Computer Vision API, which includes OCR capability, as a paid service. However, it does offer a limited free tier that allows for 5,000 transactions per month for OCR, which can be used to extract text from images. Once the free tier limit is exceeded, you will need to upgrade to a paid tier to continue using the service. The pricing for the paid tiers is usage-based and depends on the number of transactions processed. You can refer to the pricing documentation on Microsoft's website for more details.
Can it be run locally? Give an example of 5000 transactions you mentioned above.

Microsoft's Computer Vision API is a cloud-based service, therefore it is not possible to run it locally without setting up and hosting your own instance of the API. The free tier of the service enables up to 5,000 transactions per month, where a transaction refers to one OCR request on an image or video. 

For example, if you are using the OCR functionality to extract text from scanned documents, each document would count as one transaction. So, you could process up to 5,000 scanned documents or images per month using the free tier of the service. 

Keep in mind that the free tier has limitations and may not provide enough capacity for all use-cases. It's important to evaluate your usage requirements and consider upgrading to a paid tier if necessary.
Does this mean if I apply this API then Microsoft will know about my data?

Yes, Microsoft's Computer Vision API processes the data that you send to it for OCR, which means that there is potential for Microsoft to gain access to your data. According to Microsoft's Privacy policy, they collect, process, and use customer data to provide and improve their services, and to deliver personalized experiences. However, they state that they only use customer data for purposes that are described in their privacy statement or with your consent. 

It's important to carefully review the terms of service and privacy policy of any API or service that you use to understand how your data will be handled and protected. You can also take additional steps to protect your data by properly encrypting it and only sending the minimum required data to the API.

function boundKey(Key)
	local vehicleMenuKey = getKeyBoundToCommand("vehiclemenu")
	if isPedDead(localPlayer) then return end

		if not isChatBoxInputActive() and not isConsoleActive() then

				showCursor(true)

				renderTarget(DrawMenu, false)
				showCursor(false)
				if not (selected == false) then loadVehicle("Cen", selected) selected = false end
			end
		end
	end 
end

local hW, hH = sWidth / 2, sHeight / 2
local DrawColor = tocolor(0, 255, 255, 175)
local selected = false
local veh_table = {}

function DrawMenu()	
	local id = "Cen"
	local vehicles = #veh_table[id]
	local degree_C
	
	local startX, startY, endX, endY
	local t_StartX, t_StartY, t_EndX, t_EndY
	local t_AX, t_AY, t_BX, t_BY

	t_StartX, t_StartY = getRadianCoordinates(hW, hH, 30, (degree_A) + degree_C)
	t_EndX, t_EndY = getRadianCoordinates(hW, hH, 30, (degree_B) + degree_C)
	t_AX, t_AY = getRadianCoordinates(t_StartX, t_StartY, 450, (degree_A) + degree_C)
	t_BX, t_BY = getRadianCoordinates(t_EndX, t_EndY, 450, (degree_B) + degree_C)
	
	for i = 1, vehicles do
		local degree_A = (i / vehicles) * 360
		local degree_B = ((i + 1) / vehicles) * 360
		
		startX, startY = getRadianCoordinates(hW, hH, 30, degree_A)
		endX, endY = getRadianCoordinates(startX, startY, 256, degree_A)
		
		local cF = {getCursorPosition()}
		local cX, cY = (cF[1] * sWidth), (cF[2] * sHeight)
		local t_CX, t_CY = startX, startY
		
		local color = tocolor(255, 255, 255, 255)
		local color2 = tocolor(60, 255, 11, 255)
		local color3 = tocolor(255, 203, 11, 255)

		if (isInTriangle(cX, cY, t_AX, t_AY, t_BX, t_BY, t_CX, t_CY)) then
			color = tocolor(255, 203, 11, 255)
			color2 = tocolor(255, 47, 11, 255)
			color3 = tocolor(255, 47, 11, 255)
			selected = i
		end

		local vehicleName = getVehicleNameFromModel(veh_table[id][i]) .. "(" .. i .. ")"
		local textScale = 0.8
		local textWidth = dxGetTextWidth(vehicleName, textScale, "bankgothic")
		local textHeight = dxGetFontHeight(textScale, "bankgothic")

		dxDrawLine(startX, startY, endX, endY, color2)
		dxDrawText(vehicleName, startX, startY, endX, endY, color3, textScale, "bankgothic", "center", "center")
	end
end

function boundKey(Key)
	local vehicleMenuKey = getKeyBoundToCommand("vehiclemenu")
	if isPedDead(localPlayer) then return end 
	if Key == vehicleMenuKey then
		if not isChatBoxInputActive() and not isConsoleActive() then
			if (getKeyState(vehicleMenuKey)) then
				renderTarget(DrawMenu, true)
				showCursor(true)
			else
				renderTarget(DrawMenu, false)
				showCursor(false)
				if not (selected == false) then loadVehicle("Cen", selected) selected = false end
			end
		end
	end 
end
addEventHandler("onClientKey", root, boundKey)
```
